title: Since Galio is so hard to balance apparently, why not REVERT HIM?
body:
Since Riot doesn't seem to know how to get Galio in a good spot, why not revert his rework? Either he's OP or nerfed to shit, and you just made him even worse now with these current nerfs that don't hit the mark AT ALL.

You reverted Rengar, LB, and Zac now. **Revert Galio for the good of the game, please. **

replies.body:
Notably, all the reverts you mentioned were partial.

Having noted that, which parts, specifically, do you think are problematic? I can state firsthand that the Zac and Rengar communities were *very* vocal and focused about *which* things were problematic. Reverting, without understanding what about the kit is tough to balance, is definitely a mistake. 

So, what exactly do you think needs changing? Is there anything about the new kit you *want* to keep?

Nothing. I personally hate everything about his new kit. He needs to go back to his old one. His old Q hit like a damn truck but was a skillshot so it took skill to hit it, his W was a perfect, unique spell that I loved, healed him when the enemy did damage on top of buffing his stats for a few seconds, his E was a nice speed up for the whole team, and his R just settled everything nicely with a huge ass, powerful taunt that also had counterplay.

New Galio barely does any damage, melts under any type of damage and his CC is even easier to get out of it on top of being mediocre as well.

Old Galio > New Galio.

Old galio too was nerfed to shit because he had similar problems to new galio. He was a midlaner that used QE to clear the whole damn wave and then roamed.

I am guessing you are not very familiar with season 1 and 2 galio and how he was pick/ban.

Old galio needed to be nerfed so he was never viable in any semblance of high elo or pro play.


Only thing that new galio needs to have addressed is his R. It is too strong for competitive and thus means his soloq suffers because of that.
S1 and S2 Galio strengths were that there wasnt as much mobility/cc back then and he had Chalice of Harmony and FoN... hard to compare Galio overall from when he had the best options for him.

But essentially he was a roaming tank mid laner with great teamfighting that would wave clear with 2 buttons the whole wave.


I think his old kit would have the same issues as his current hit if they were to make him pro-viable and challenger elo viable. So he would be nerfed again and end up being played only by mains. That's no balanced state for a champion

The Old Galio would very rarely be considered Pro Viable, was too easy to counter his ult with QSS, Cleanse, Oranges.

He had issues, I just preferred him.

He would be able to ramp up the damage if he ulted in a wave and he would be unkillable if built tank.

Ola Galio doesnt have the Uptime the current Galio has where he always has access to his full burst, and almost new Galio has better Mana Management because he was able to focus on farming with one Spell and/or Passive rather than two spells.

EDIT: ALSO I preferred him top lane... just sucked against Nasus because it was a farm lame where we couldnt kill eachother... and you know how that goes with a free farmed Nasus lol
Wait, didn't his ult reapply the taunt immediately? Wasn't it like a continuous effect like soraka current E?
No
I mean old Galio wasn't even possible to balance so they had to keep him perma weak.
Permaweak = had the highest winrate mid and toplane on average per patch for 3 years
With what play rate? And at what elo?
Every Elo.   At like a 1 6% playrate.
So, you are saying that season 5 Galio for example had 1,6% playrate and a decent winrate(which would mean like 53%+ for that play rate) in diamond/challenger?

Yes, also we are kind of Hijacking this thread. 

Kinda covering points in circles.
Ok, you are right. Sorry OP. Wasn't intentional. And we were kinda on topic.
No he wasn't. He was fine in balance besides high mana costs. He was just unpopular, not weak.
He was "unpopular" for a reason. Plus his old kit was too clunky to even play with as a solo laner.

The reason he was unpopular is no one read his Kit. 

MR numbers were low back then and all people did on Galio is build MR when all he needed was 1 MR item.

In fact his highest winrates were against Yasuo and Talon which shows the heavy MR build was garbage.

People got tricked by his passive (which was the worst part of his old kit) other than his extra lvl 1 AP and AP gained from his W.

No, he was nerfed a lot because he was really good in pro play in season 1 and early season 2. And was just kept nerfed enough so he wasn't ever picked in pro or any real high elo. His kit was super problematic.

No it wasn't. He took skill but it wasn't extreme. I picked him up fast, including getting a quadra kill as my last game on him before his rework came in. 

He was only unpopular because Riot started spitting out all the overloaded, hyper mobile, overpowered shit they have been doing for the past few years. That's all.

Fair, I guess I mean he felt really bad for a large portion of player bc of his mana costs and ult cd were ultra high. Those were the only things they could really adjust on him bc his poke/wave-clear was almost unavoidable, his sustain was awesome, and arguably the best ult in the game.
because riot doesnt admit to their mistakes

Oh hush now. This is no place for evidence based logic.

I think changing/partial revert to his W and make his damage reduction into his old on damage heal he had on his W would be nice. 

And to not let his W be overloaded and problematic you can put his spellshield on his passive.

Yes I post this all the time and no I wont stop. 

Hopefully Riot will make that change sooner than later.

I'm 31 now... maybe when I'm 35.

So, no taunt? The whole point of galio RN is to Flash W. 

Also, I am guessing you mean his W would not be able to be put on allies. But his R would put it on allies.

I accept that hey would never change Galio to how he was even though that was some of the best times of my life.

What I'm saying is W functions the way it does jow but instead of DR he has an On Damage Heal. 
No Armor/MR boost and no placing that on allies. 
Just the same ability with On Damage Heal.

And I wouldn't do anything to his ULT either.
Oh, that's reasonable then. I totally misunderstood at the begining. that would be cool because galio would be rewarded more per enemy hit with W but wouldn't be able to get his DR if he whiffed it.

Those are 3 terrible examples. Only Rengar's Q got reverted, most of LeBlanc's kit was extremely similar aside the Q spreads & a different ult, and only Zac's ult got reverted. What's better: None of them were VGU.
I know, I just was lazy in my explanation. I still think the VGU needs to be reverted anyway.

he isn't hard to balance
Riot just doesn't know what kind of a champion they want him to be

Tank? protector? initiator? mage?assassin?
sylas is getting the same treatment every nerf changes his play and build patterns

so it's more of an identity issue than a balance pain

> so it's more of an identity issue than a balance pain

This is essentially his issue. When they reworked him, they made him an anti-magic tank. Then they wanted him to still be able to build a mix of AP and tank, and have good waveclear for midlane, which made him oppressive toplane. He got shifted so he had to build more AP in order to deal the damage they wanted him to do. But he was still dealing too much damage and also too tanky, plus a semi global ult, and they just kept hitting him, especially for proplay (same as Shen). His issues mainly started when they built him to be tank at first and shifted him more to AP bruiser.

Tangent: This is why I fear Riot will try to salvage AP Malphite alongside Tank Malphite if they give him more kit-work.

With how tank items are atm. I'd rather they make malp an ap AOE assassin tbh. 
Either that or tank items need a rework the scale that AP items got.

Galio's not hard to balance. Riot just doesnt know what they want to do with him. 

"hey this champion is being played outside of solo lanes! Better buff his damage and nerf everything else!!" 
No, he's being played Support because he's USELESS ELSEWHERE. Restore his waveclear, restore his tank stats and ... why does his W deal damage since when did it do this? 
And then buff tank items to be slightly (200-350g) more expensive but have much better stats. Except abyssal mask, just reduce the combine cost on it and remove the CDR tacked on for no good reason please.
Change his ult, it's too powerful in pro play, and hard to use in soloqueue.
